WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: This cross is the symbol for the number ten. A good way to remember this is to think about all the religions that have crosses and also important sets of tens.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: If you're familiar with Christianity, they have a cross and ten commandments. Cross = ten, you see?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This cross in particular has ten jewels (ã˜ã‚…ã†) on it. Two on each arm and two in the middle. That's ten jewels!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the jewels on this cross. Maybe draw it out on a piece of paper so the visual really sticks. Each cross is really a symbol for different sets of ten things, and in this case, it's ten jewels.

origin_of_ch_char_book: Along with Heaven, the Earth was an object of worship. The people who developed the Hanzi system built an earthen pillar (åœŸ, tu, earth). In fact, the pillar means ten (å, shi, ten) which also means â€˜manyâ€™. So we can see this character describes the land from which many creatures sprout. The â€œShuo Wen Jie Zi (Explanation of Chinese Characters)â€ written about 2,000 years ago says that â€œ â€˜Tuâ€™ means that earth regurgitates living things.â€ In other words, all the living things came from the Earth. Therefore, in ancient society, it was very important to worship Mother Earth which gave birth to all living things.,Old rectangular ruler (ç›´, ç›´, zhi=chih, straight) On the left side is an ancient rectangular ruler , which was used to build a building or manufacture a product. The top is a 10 (å, shi, ten), which means â€˜manyâ€™, and an eye in the below (ç›®, mu, eye). The craftsman is measuring something repeatedly with a rectangular ruler. It is now used as â€˜straightâ€™, â€˜honestâ€™.
humanum_full_description_en:
> " Ten " oracle bone inscriptions and early inscriptions made a vertical painting "ä¸¨". There are many opinions on its configuration. Some people think that the word is like " pin ". The ancients recorded the number " ten " with the pictogram of " pin " (Qiu Xigui). Yu Shengwu believes that when counting to a decimal, it returns to one. In order to avoid confusion with â€œ one â€, it is written as â€œä¸¨â€. Zhu Fangpu thinks that the " ten " is like a stick. Guo Moruo and Zhang Bingquan think that it is the shape of two palms together. The fingers of the two palms are ten. When they stand together, they can only see a straight line with a slight drum on both sides. Ma Xulun thought it was like a knotted rope, and the ancient knotted rope was used for counting. "Shuowen": "Ten is the tool of numbering. One is east and west, ä¸¨ is north and south, and the center of the four sides is prepared. All ten belongings are from ten."

In the inscriptions of the middle Western Zhou Dynasty, the " ten " character may add a dot in the middle of the vertical stroke, and the dot may be made into a hollow shape. After the Spring and Autumn Period, the dot stretches into a short horizontal shape, which is similar to the shape of the " 7 ". Luo Zhenyu pointed out that the short one is " ten " and the long one is " seven. " See " Seven ".

Oracle bone inscriptions are used as numerals and can be used as ordinal numbers. "Collection" 1654: "October." Can also be used as a base number. "Composition" 110 reverses: "Dian enter ten", which means paying ten (a turtle shell). Also "Collection" 29572: "Ten prisons", refers to ten captive sacrifice animals.

Bronze inscriptions are also used as numerals. This tripod: "Bao Yimao was born in ten and seven years in ten and two months." Xian ğ£ª•: "Shipiao (world) does not forget to devote oneself to (in) Bi Gong's house", "Ten Shi" emptily refers to generations, that is, eternal righteousness; " Xian " is a name. The whole sentence means that you will never forget to dedicate yourself to the service of Bi Gong.

Bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were also used as numerals, "Tsinghua Bamboo Slips II. "Lian Year" Jane 3: "Ten and four years, King Li gave birth to King Xuan, and King Xuan was established immediately."
humanum_short_description_en: " ten " Oracle and inscriptions as early pricked painting " Shu " elephant " pin " the beginning of the text, to the ancients " needle pictographic symbols" to record the number " ten " (Qiu Xigui).

> " Ten" oracle bone inscriptions and early inscriptions made a vertical painting " ä¸¨". There are many opinions on its configuration. Some people think that the word is like " pin". The ancients recorded the number " ten" with the pictogram of " pin" (Qiu Xigui). Yu Shengwu believes that when counting to a decimal, it returns to one. In order to avoid confusion with â€œ one â€, it is written as â€œ ä¸¨ â€. Zhu Fangpu thinks that the " ten" is like a stick. Guo Moruo and Zhang Bingquan think that it is the shape of two palms together. The fingers of the two palms are ten. When they stand together, they can only see a straight line with a slight drum on both sides. Ma Xulun thought it was like a knotted rope, and the ancient knotted rope was used for counting. "Shuowen": "Ten is the tool of numbering. One is east and west, ä¸¨ is north and south, and the center of the four sides is prepared. All ten belongings are from ten." In the inscriptions of the middle Western Zhou Dynasty, the " ten" character may add a dot in the middle of the vertical stroke, and the dot may be made into a hollow shape. After the Spring and Autumn Period, the dot stretches into a short horizontal shape, which is similar to the shape of the " 7". Luo Zhenyu pointed out that the short one is " ten" and the long one is " seven." See " Seven". Oracle bone inscriptions are used as numerals and can be used as ordinal numbers. "Collection" 1654: "October." Can also be used as a base number. "Composition" 110 reverses: "Dian enter ten", which means paying ten (a turtle shell). Also "Collection" 29572: "Ten prisons", refers to ten captive sacrifice animals. Bronze inscriptions are also used as numerals. This tripod: "Bao Yimao was born in ten and seven years in ten and two months." Xian ğ£ª•: "Shipiao (world) does not forget to devote oneself to (in) Bi Gong's house", "Ten Shi" emptily refers to generations, that is, eternal righteousness; " Xian" is a name. The whole sentence means that you will never forget to dedicate yourself to the service of Bi Gong. Bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were also used as numerals, "Tsinghua Bamboo Slips II. "Lian Year" Jane 3: "Ten and four years, King Li gave birth to King Xuan, and King Xuan was established immediately."

Radicals: å  (cross)
Meaning Mnemonic
This cross is the symbol for the number ten. A good way to remember this is to think about all the religions that have crosses and also important sets of tens.
If you're familiar with Christianity, they have a cross and ten commandments. Cross = ten, you see?
Reading Mnemonic
This cross in particular has ten jewels (ã˜ã‚…ã†) on it. Two on each arm and two in the middle. That's ten jewels!
Picture the jewels on this cross. Maybe draw it out on a piece of paper so the visual really sticks. Each cross is really a symbol for different sets of ten things, and in this case, it's ten jewels.
